column3:
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Select the appropriate country code through List of Values.\par
}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The description of the tax ID type report code.\par
}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The layout format to use for the tax ID numbers. For example, if you specify a layout format of XXX-X-XX and the tax number ID is 123456, the number will be formatted as 123-4-56.\par
}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 The report code for which you defining a value. The system automatically creates five report codes for Argentinean companies. If you do not assign customized internal names to these codes, they will be listed as Report Code 1, Report Code 2, Report Code 3, etc. If you do specify custom internal names (in the \b\i\f0 Tax \f0 Report Codes \f0 for Argentina\b0\i0  \f0 window), the internal names you assigned will be listed here. You cannot change the report code names in this window.\par
}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The ID for the tax type you are defining. You must enter a value in this field.\par
}
